title: No Crosby, no problem? What we learned in Canada's thrilling 4-3 win over Czechia
content: The overwhelming tournament favorites needed a late tying goal and overtime to win, but they made the semis.

title: Marner saves Canada with OT goal vs. Czechia
content: Nick Suzuki tied it with 3:27 left, Mitch Marner scored in OT and Canada rallied to beat Czechia 4-3 to avoid a stunning quarterfinal exit at the Olympics.

title: Canada's Crosby leaves with injury, ruled out
content: Sidney Crosby left Canada's Olympic quarterfinal hockey matchup against Czechia in the second period with a lower-body injury and was ruled out for the game.

title: Allen estate begins process of selling Seahawks
content: According to the wishes of late team owner Paul Allen, the estate announced Wednesday it has begun the process of selling the Seahawks.

title: KC reworks Mahomes deal for massive cap room
content: The Chiefs restructured Patrick Mahomes' contract this week, creating much-needed salary cap space ahead of the 2026 season, according to ESPN and multiple reports.

title: Proud Shiffrin ends drought, dominates slalom
content: Mikaela Shiffrin put in two dominant runs to win the Olympic women's slalom by 1.50 seconds and end a wait for another medal that stretched back to 2018.

content: The Cavs' title odds improved with the trade for James Harden, but the Thunder and Nuggets are clear favorites.

content: Ryan Garcia is a supremely talented fighter at a career crossroads. Can he lock in and finally win a world championship?

content: Everything seemed to be falling into place for Barcelona, but losing the top spot in LaLiga has exposed squad issues that must be addressed this summer.

title: Multi-speciality hospitals to be set up in State under PPP model
content: The initiative aims at strengthening healthcare access across the State, Health Minister Satya Kumar informs Legislative Assembly

content: The amendment allows voter registration on four qualifying dates each year ‚Äî January 1, April 1, July 1, and October 1, and aligns Panchayat Raj institutions with the existing system followed for Assembly and Parliament elections

content: Speaker Ayyanna Patrudu notes that land issues persist across the State and stresses effective implementation of guidelines

content: The operation underscores the changing security landscape in Gadchiroli, where the administration is focusing on development and security after years of insurgency

content: The seer claims that trees and vegetation surrounding the Raghav Chaitanya Shivalinga on the Ladle Mashak Dargah‚Äôs premises had been cleared and a platform-like structure had been constructed at the spot recently.

content: India‚Äôs decision not to sign the statement or join the U.S.-led Board of Peace seen as linked to Modi‚Äôs upcoming visit to Israel

content: Vibrant Village Programme, originally aimed at areas along China border, will now be launched in villages along  Pakistan, Nepal, Bangladesh, Bhutan, and Myanmar also

content: CRPF-led ‚ÄúKGH-2‚Äù targets top CPI (Maoist) leadership as government pushes to end left-wing extremism by March 2026

title: Watch: Anganwadi workers across T.N. intensify protest over pay and job regularisation
content: Anganwadi and nutritious meal workers across Tamil Nadu have continued their agitation for the 15th consecutive day, demanding regularisation and a ‚Çπ19,500 minimum basic pay promised in the DMK‚Äôs 2021 manifesto

title: A.P. SIPB approves 27 projects with¬†investments of ‚Çπ29,021 crore
content: Speed of Doing Business policy should be the guiding principle in all matters related to industrial projects, says Naidu

title: Look into plea for special law on hate crimes: SC to Attorney General
content: The Supreme Court said that classifying crime on the basis of the identity of the victim may run the danger of dividing the society

title: Madras High Court denies interim relief to political parties de-registered for not contesting elections in last six years
content: Chief Justice Manindra Mohan Shrivastava and Justice G. Arul Murugan say the parties cannot be allowed to contest Assembly elections by granting an interim stay

title: Target 50% votes per booth, BJP chief Nitin Nabin tells Assam party workers
content: Nitin Nabin begins his two-day visit to the poll-bound State by addressing a Panna Pramukh Sammelan in Dibrugarh

title: PM to address AI summit on February 19, world leaders gather
content: The plenary session will bring together several heads of state and government, with PM Modi‚Äôs address followed by keynote presentations by global tech leaders

title: Culture Ministry funded event platformed incendiary ‚Äòhate speech‚Äô: Congress
content: The Congress claimed that the Sanatan Sanstha was under investigation by the Karnataka government in connection with the murders of journalist Gauri Lankesh and scholar M.M. Kalburgi

title: SOP to verify authenticity of academic and other certificates of guest faculty of degree colleges
content: A ‚ÄòCertificate Verification Committee‚Äô should be mandatorily formed in every government first-grade college to verify the authenticity of the educational certificates of the guest faculty, as per the SOP

title: Simultaneous polls panel weighs bar on no-confidence motions in final year of government‚Äôs term
content: Panel chairperson P.P. Chaudhary says Panchayati Raj laws in many States have similar restrictions, and the committee could propose introduction of a similar clause in the simultaneous polls legislation¬†¬†¬†

title: KSPL plans ‚Çπ200 crore expansion of Offshore Supply Vessel Complex
content: ¬†The Rs.200 crore expansion aims at additional handling of four MTPA of cargo, support the accommodation of Indian Navy and Coast Guard vessels and strengthening offshore logistics capability for oil and natural gas exploration in the Krishna-Godavari basin.

title: Urumi swish draws crowd to 11th¬†Ponnyathankam
content: The week-long fete is organised by Kerala Folklore Academy, Kathirur panchayat and Pattiyam Gopalan Memorial Library. What began in 2015 as a modest Kalari demonstration by a local reading room has since evolved into one of the largest martial arts congregations, drawing participants from across India and abroad

title: Kerala to regularise over 20,000 teacher posts
content: Govt. extends to all aided school managements the relaxation granted to¬†NSS for making permanent appointments to posts other than those reserved for the differently abled,¬†subject to SC verdict. Over 20,000 provisional teachers are expected to benefit

title: Above 5,300 acres set for exclusion from Kolleru Lake in West Godavari
content: The entire land has been earmarked in the 10 villages for the exclusion as part of downsizing the Kolleru Lake.

title: ‚ÄòIndia, UK resolve to deepen cooperation in AI, next-generation telecommunications‚Äô
content: The meeting held on the sidelines of the AI Summit in Delhi explored cooperation in autonomous network management, AI-driven cybersecurity, spectrum innovation and non-terrestrial networks

title: TTD Chairman rubbishes Bhumana‚Äôs claim on supply of ghee by Indapur Dairy
content: Karnataka Milk Federation always remained the TTD‚Äôs biggest and dependable ghee supplier,  meeting a whopping 62% of its total requirement, says B.R. Naidu

title: Kerala has sufficient land for industrial development: Balagopal
content: Minister was addressing a round table discussion on ‚ÄòKerala‚Äôs Development: Next Stage‚Äô organised by C. Achutha Menon Foundation

title: Aalin‚Äôs death sparks a campaign for child safety in Kerala
content: The State Transport department is planning to resume the awareness campaign highlighting the need to use Child Restraint System in vehicles following the tragic death of Aalin, says C. Nagaraju, State Transport Commissioner

title: Legislative Council stalled for second day as YSRCP insists on debating TTD ghee issue
content: Council Chairman Moshenu Raju rejects its adjournment motion seeking emergency discussion on supply of ghee to the TTD by Indapur Dairy, which, it claims, has links with Heritage Foods

title: Hubballi: Strict measures are being taken to curb drugs, says DGP of Prisons
content: Alok Kumar says that inmates are being subjected to regular medical check-ups to detect any access to or use of narcotics.

title: To counter foreign terrorists, CRPF sets up temporary bases upto 6,000 feet mark in J&K
content: This is part of a new strategy to flush out terrorists who have moved from the Valley floor to the upper reaches; bases house CRPF teams launching search and assault operations, heading as high as 8,900 feet

title: India turns away from Russia? Data show 3-yr dip in oil import share; who's filling the gap
content: India has significantly reduced its reliance on Russian crude oil, with January imports hitting their lowest point since late 2022. This shift sees Middle Eastern suppliers, particularly Saudi Arabia, regaining prominence as India diversifies its energy sources. The move aligns with international pressures and India's commitment to strategic autonomy.

title: US-Iran war will be massive, could last weeks; Israel may join offensive: Report
content: Tensions escalate as US officials warn of a massive, weeks-long military operation against Iran, potentially alongside Israel, targeting its nuclear and missile programs. Diplomatic talks are ongoing but face significant hurdles, with a 90% chance of kinetic action predicted by some advisors. Israel also prepares for imminent conflict.

title: Unbeaten but Unconvincing: India sweep group stage 4-0 ‚Äî Tougher tests await in Super 8
content: India secured four wins in the T20 World Cup group stage but batting has been inconsistent. Different players have rescued the team in each match. The opening has been the biggest concern as the World No.1 T20I batter Abhishek Sharma is yet to score a run in the tournament.

title: Zuckerberg's $50M donation to California may be his 'parting gift' to the State
content: Mark Zuckerberg is reportedly making significant investments in Sacramento, California, while simultaneously acquiring a lavish Miami mansion. This move, alongside other tech titans like Larry Page and Sergey Brin relocating to Florida, is fueled by California's proposed Billionaire Tax Act. The potential 5% tax on net worth exceeding $1 billion could cost Zuckerberg billions, prompting a westward exodus.

title: First propaganda, then damage control: How Galgotias University walked back its claim over robodog row
content: Galgotias University apologized for misrepresenting a commercially available robotic dog as an in-house innovation at the AI Impact Summit 2026. The university blamed a professor for providing incorrect information, a stark contrast to its initial claims of a "propaganda campaign." The incident drew criticism from opposition leaders, who called the summit a "disorganized PR spectacle."

title: J&K juvenile home breakout: Five detained, hunt on for third escapee
content: Authorities are intensifying their search for local gangster Karanjit Singh, also known as Gugga, who escaped a Jammu juvenile home with two Pakistani inmates. The Pakistani nationals were apprehended in Ambala and handed over to Jammu and Kashmir Police. Gugga, believed to be the escape's architect, remains at large, with his mother also missing.

title: Google AI CEO tells everyone why Gemini & ChatGPT winning International Maths Olympiad is not big
content: Google AI CEO Demis Hassabis stated that AI systems solving complex Maths Olympiad problems do not prove general intelligence. These systems can still err on basic math and are 'frozen' after training. They struggle with long-term strategies and consistency across tasks. Hassabis emphasized the need for AI that learns continuously and plans for the future.

title: Kashmir division has more voters than Jammu, new data shows
content: Kashmir division now boasts more registered voters than Jammu, with the Union Territory tallying over 8.7 million. Srinagar district leads in third-gender voters.  This surge in the Valley's electorate is linked to increased youth and first-time voter participation following past boycotts, according to MLA Waheed Parra. The Election Commission employs annual revisions to update rolls.

title: Tourism in J&K on revival path, says govt; data shows slump in 2025 after Pahalgam attack
content: Jammu and Kashmir's tourism sector is showing signs of recovery following a significant downturn after the April 2025 Pahalgam terror attack. Government initiatives, including promotional efforts, have boosted tourist footfalls during the winter season. Despite a dip in 2025 compared to 2024, efforts are underway to further revive the industry, which contributes substantially to the state's economy.

title: India eyes diversification: Goyal says would 'love' high-quality coal from US
content: Piyush Goyal said India is looking to broaden its sourcing of crude oil and coking coal and would welcome supplies of premium-quality coking coal from the United States.

title: Poland bans entry of Chinese cars at Army locations, says, 'to reduce the risk of ‚Ä¶ '
content: Poland has banned Chinese-made cars from its military facilities, citing risks of uncontrolled data acquisition and use by these systems. This move enhances infrastructure security and aligns with NATO practices. Restrictions also apply to government workers' official phones connected to Chinese vehicle infotainment systems.

title: "I was genuinely not expecting this..": Foreigner blown away by IRCTC Thali
content: A foreign traveler's delighted reaction to a full meal served on an Indian train has gone viral, challenging preconceptions about railway food.  The content creator praised the quality and variety of the vegetarian thali, including rice, dal, paneer, and dessert.  This highlights the impressive hospitality managed by IRCTC on select long-distance journeys.

title: Best days in 2026 to take important decisions
content: In 2026, Saturn's influence encourages thoughtful, well-timed decisions rather than impulsive actions. Specific dates each month, from March to December, offer opportune moments for structured thinking, practical planning, and commitments that are likely to hold their ground and endure.

title: Rashee Rice faces $1M lawsuit over domestic violence claim
content: Kansas City Chiefs player Rashee Rice is now facing a major civil lawsuit. His former partner Dacoda Jones has filed a case seeking over one million dollars. She alleges a pattern of domestic violence over nearly two years. The NFL is investigating these serious claims. Rice is already on probation from a previous incident.

title: Rampage livestream erupts as Deen gets hit twice
content: A late-night house party hosted by former UFC star Quinton ‚ÄúRampage‚Äù Jackson turned chaotic after a physical fight broke out between retired MMA fighter Tiki Ghosn and streamer Deen The Great. The confrontation was streamed live. The clips of the party went viral on social media. Viewers watched as a verbal argument escalated in front of guests.

title: Golden State lands $60M Celtics center, ends Giannis pursuit
content: The Golden State Warriors have acquired Kristaps Porzingis from the Atlanta Hawks, trading away Jonathan Kuminga and Buddy Hield. This move aims to bolster the frontcourt and scoring after Jimmy Butler's season-ending injury. While Porzingis offers valuable spacing and shooting, his durability remains a significant concern for the team's playoff aspirations.

title: Ryan Williams, 19, announces engagement to Alexis Hill, 25
content: Alabama wide receiver Ryan Williams, 19, announced his engagement to 25-year-old Alexis Hill on Valentine‚Äôs Day. Hill, who has one child from a previous relationship, shared photos of her ring on Instagram. NFL insider Dov Kleiman reported the news on X, leading to mixed reactions online. Some fans celebrated, while others debated the couple‚Äôs six-year age gap.

title: From India-US subsea cables to $30M AI sci challenge ‚Äì Key initiatives unveiled by Google
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai announced a significant commitment to India's AI growth, unveiling a new India-US subsea cable initiative and a $30 million AI for Science fund. These initiatives, alongside expanded skilling partnerships, aim to bolster AI connectivity and accelerate scientific breakthroughs, positioning India for an "extraordinary trajectory" in AI.

title: Salim Khan health update: Doctors clarify that he was not in critical condition
content: Veteran screenwriter Salim Khan, 90, was admitted to Lilavati Hospital on Tuesday morning after suffering a haemorrhage. Hospital officials confirmed that he was brought in around 8.30 am by his family physician, Dr Sandeep Chopra, following a sudden deterioration in his health.

title: NPS: Not just a tax-saving tool ‚Äî new rules, retirement benefits & more explained
content: As India's private sector workforce steps into a new era of financial independence, individuals are urged to take charge of their retirement savings. The National Pension System (NPS) stands out as a strategic investment choice, boasting market-driven returns and offering recent updates that enhance user flexibility.

title: Huge blow! Pathirana ruled out of T20 World Cup, IPL 2026 in doubt
content: Sri Lanka's T20 World Cup campaign faces a blow as fast bowler Matheesha Pathirana is ruled out due to a muscle strain sustained against Australia. Dilshan Madushanka has been approved as his replacement. Pathirana's injury, which occurred early in his spell, also raises concerns for his IPL franchise, Kolkata Knight Riders.

title: How is gold buying & selling taxed in India? Check short & long-term capital gains tax rules on gold assets
content: Investment in gold can happen through various avenues: physical pure gold like coins or bars, gold jewellery, or even through digital forms and investment avenues like exchange trade funds (ETFs), mutual funds, and sovereign gold bonds.

title: 'Be powerful, abandon rest': RSS chief on 'thinking' of US, China
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat has criticised the United States and China. He stated that Western countries spread fundamentalism. Bhagwat asserted India possesses solutions to global problems. He called for accelerating 'Ghar Wapsi'. Bhagwat also urged Hindus to have at least three children. He emphasized strengthening India in all areas to become a world leader.

title: 'We've beaten India once, unlike our ex-cricketers': Shadab hits back at Afridi
content: Shadab Khan responded strongly to criticism from Mohammad Yousuf and Shahid Afridi after Pakistan‚Äôs loss to India, defending senior players and the team‚Äôs process. The all-rounder cited Pakistan‚Äôs lone World Cup win over India in 2021, brushed aside external criticism, and stressed that the team remains focused on winning the T20 World Cup.

title: This day, that year: When India launched the world‚Äôs first official airmail service
content: In 1911, Prayagraj witnessed the world's first official airmail service, a 13-minute flight by French aviator Henri Pequet carrying 6,500 letters. This pioneering event, staged at the UP Exhibition, marked a significant leap from pigeon post, demonstrating the potential of powered flight to conquer distance and reshape global communication.  The historic flight launched a new era in postal history.

title: After BMC setback, Raj Thackeray meets Eknath Shinde amid MNS unease
content: Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray met Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde in Mumbai, marking their first interaction since the BMC elections. The meeting, which covered various issues, follows MNS's support for Shinde's Shiv Sena in Kalyan-Dombivli and Shinde's praise for Thackeray's broader perspective in decision-making.

title: Domestic violence case: Supreme Court issues notice to cricketer Mohammad Shami on wife's plea
content: The Supreme Court has directed cricketer Mohammad Shami to respond to his estranged wife's plea to transfer multiple cases, including a domestic violence one, from West Bengal to Delhi.  The court issued notices to Shami and others, seeking their replies on the transfer petitions. This follows an earlier plea for increased maintenance for their daughter.

title: 'Join Galgotias as Professor of Spin': Mahua jabs Vaishnaw amid robodog row
content: ‚ÄãMahua Moitra also shared a Vaishnaw's deleted X post in which he had purportedly praised the Galgotias University's robodog, which triggered a massive backlash online over its Chinese origins. ‚Äã In the post, as was posted by the TMC leader, Vaishnaw had said: "Bharat's sovereign models are performing well on global benchmarks."

title: ‚ÄòKya karoge jaan ke‚Äô: Murdered MBA student‚Äôs boyfriend shows no remorse, smirks at reporters
content: Accused in the murder of an MBA student displayed striking indifference during a crime scene reconstruction, brushing aside reporters' questions. Police described his demeanor as unusually calm and detached, noting his claims of wanting to communicate with the victim's spirit and his consumption of occult content.

title: Ramadan Mubarak 2026: Messages to share with your friends & families
content: Ramadan 2026 begins around February 18-19 in India, marking a period of fasting, prayer, and reflection for Muslims. This sacred month, one of Islam's pillars, emphasizes spiritual growth and community. It culminates in Eid ul-Fitr on March 19-20, a joyous festival celebrating the end of the fast.

title: Three ducks in a row: Abhishek out for zero vs NED; yet to score a run in T20 WC
content: Abhishek Sharma's T20 World Cup campaign hit a new low as he registered his third consecutive duck against the Netherlands. The left-handed batter was dismissed for a first-ball duck by Aryan Dutt. India, having already qualified for the Super Eights, elected to bat first in their final group stage match.

title: Sahibzada Farhan: Once made documentary on hitting sixes off Bumrah, now a World Cup centurion
content: Never short of headlines, Sahibzada Farhan completed a full-circle moment with a scintillating T20 World Cup century against Namibia in Colombo. From challenging selection norms and going unsold in the PSL to becoming only Pakistan‚Äôs second World Cup centurion. Pakistan defeated Namibia by 102 runs to cement their place in the Super Eight

title: Maruti Suzuki e-Vitara full price list revealed: Check variant-wise pricing, features
content: Features-wise, it gets a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster, a 10.1-inch infotainment screen supported by wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, cloud-based navigation, panoramic sunroof, ambient lighting with 12 colour options and ventilated front seats. Apart from that, it gets features such as wireless charging, a JBL sound system, automatic climate control, multiple USB ports, and an in-cabin air purifier.

title: Sit, stay, run: Dog gatecrashes Olympic sprint, crosses finish line - watch
content: A surprise guest stole the show at the Milan-Cortina Winter Games. An unregistered dog dashed onto the cross-country ski course during the women's team free sprint. The enthusiastic canine chased competitors, even crossing the finish line. Officials eventually intervened, escorting the four-legged interloper off the piste. His unscheduled Olympic bid ended abruptly.

title: Diamond-shaped house in Hyderabad turns luxury real estate into legacy
content: Hyderabad's real estate boasts a unique diamond-shaped house. This structure represents P. P. Reddy's journey from humble beginnings to infrastructure giant. Its design mirrors ambition and success. Such landmark homes derive value from unique architecture, prime location, and compelling personal narratives. This residence stands as a testament to persistence and vision, a biography etched in stone and steel.

title: More trouble for Galgotias University? After Chinese robodog, Korean soccer drone
content: Galgotias University is under renewed scrutiny at the India AI Impact Summit. Following controversy over a robotic dog, the institution now faces questions about a drone soccer arena. Faculty claimed it as an in-house innovation, but social media users point to similar commercially available products from South Korea. The university was asked to vacate its stall at the summit.

title: Pakistan in T20 World Cup Super 8, become eighth team to advance
content: Pakistan secured their Super Eight spot in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026, becoming the final qualifier. They joined powerhouses like India, West Indies, and England in the next phase. The tournament's top two from each group have advanced, setting up two exciting groups of four for the Super 8 stage.

title: 40 Tonnes A Day: Delhi To Build New Biomedical Waste Treatment Plants
content: Delhi is producing nearly 40 tonnes of biomedical waste every day, from syringes and surgical waste to lab material and used protective gear. With volumes projected to rise in the coming years, the capital is preparing to add new treatment capacity.

title: FedEx To Invest Rs 2,500 Crore For Automated Cargo Hub At Navi Mumbai Airport
content: Express transportation company FedEx announced on Wednesday that it will invest over Rs 2,500 crore in setting up a fully automated cargo hub at Navi Mumbai International Airport in partnership with the Adani Group.

title: PM Modi, Bhutan PM Tobgay Discuss Boosting Partnership In Key Sectors
content: Bhutan's Prime Minister Tshering Tobgay and Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday reviewed the progress in bilateral cooperation in several key sectors.

title: India Sets World Record For Most AI Responsibility Pledges In 24 Hours
content: Union Minister for Electronics and IT, Ashwini Vaishnaw, on Wednesday announced that India has achieved the Guinness World Records title for the "Most pledges received for an AI responsibility campaign in 24 hours".

title: Assam Ex Congress Chief Bhupen Borah Tells NDTV Why He Decided To Join BJP
content: In Assam, it goes without saying that the ruling BJP's gain is the Opposition Congress's loss. This time, the Assam Congress faces an even bigger loss.

title: NDTV Summit: Experts On How AI Is Transforming Healthcare, Workforce
content: Artificial intelligence has a bright future in India and one of the areas where it can have prolific use is medicine, agreed a panel of experts at the NDTV AI Summit today.

title: Video: Meet Addverb Technology's Robot Dog That Works On Real-Time Data
content: As businesses worldwide embrace automation and robotics to boost productivity, Addverb Technology co-founder Bir Singh showcased Trakr, India's first assistive dog robot, at the NDTV Ind.ai summit in Delhi.

title: Former Army Chief Opens Up About Rift With Zelensky, Seen As His Top Rival
content: Ever since he was ousted as the head of Ukraine's army in 2024 and appointed as the country's ambassador to Britain, Valerii Zaluzhnyi has widely been seen as the top political rival to President Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: "Misinformation Can't Be Encouraged": Centre On Galgotias Row
content: A professor had said a robotic dog displayed at the India AI Impact Summit was developed by the Galgotias University. The dog was a product of China's Unitree Robotics.

title: DMK Launches Statewide Door-To-Door Drive To Counter Vijay's Women Appeal
content: With actor-turned-politician Vijay stepping up his political pitch and expected to woo large sections of women voters, the ruling DMK has launched a focused counter, a statewide, booth-level door-to-door outreach exclusively led by women cadre.

title: J&K's Doodhpathri Reopens For Tourists, Livelihood Restored After 10 Months
content: After a 10-month forced furlough, Reyaz Ahmad has finally welcomed his first customer for a horse ride at Doodhpathri in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam district.

title: Why Bangladesh PM Tarique Rahman Is Being Mocked With "Engineer" Memes
content: The newly sworn-in Bangladesh Prime Minister Tarique Rahman seems to be the recipient of an unexpected moniker.

title: Stopped From Giving Board Exams, Class 10 Student Ends Life In Patna
content: A class 10 student died by suicide after being denied entry to her examination centre for arriving 10 minutes late. The student, identified as Komal Kumari, jumped from a moving train in Maharajchak village in Patna.

title: Garbage Piles Up As Bengaluru Residents Block Key Waste Processing Units

title: Fire Breaks Out Near Iranian Capital Tehran: Reports
content: A fire broke out in Iran's Parand near the capital city Tehran, state media reported on Wednesday, publishing videos of smoke rising over the area, which is close to several military and strategic sites in the country's Tehran province.

title: Tech Brings Huge Changes, But Creativity Still Human: Filmmakers On Using AI

title: Ghosts of the past: Why Pakistan is in perpetual crisis
